docs.snippet: BOGOTA, Colombia, July 20 -- President Eduardo Santos formally convened Congress today to begin its legislative labors for 1941. In his message to Congress he reported the economic condition of the country fundamentally sound and stressed the...
docs.lead_paragraph: BOGOTA, Colombia, July 20 -- President Eduardo Santos formally convened Congress today to begin its legislative labors for 1941. In his message to Congress he reported the economic condition of the country fundamentally sound and stressed the importance of the country's international relations.
docs.abstract: Colombian Pres Santos stresses friendship with U S

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, July 22 -- Immediate construction of a $70,000,000 pipeline system to carry 250,000 barrels of crude oil daily from the East Texas fields to the Eastern seaboard was urged upon the oil industry today by Harold L. Ickes, the Petroleum...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 22 -- Immediate construction of a $70,000,000 pipeline system to carry 250,000 barrels of crude oil daily from the East Texas fields to the Eastern seaboard was urged upon the oil industry today by Harold L. Ickes, the Petroleum Coordinator, just after Congress completed action on the bill authorizing Federal aid for private pipeline building.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, July 24 (AP) -- The German news agency, Transocean, colored its dispatches from New York to South America to indicate "Yankee intervention" in Latin America's domestic affairs, according to testimony given in District Court today by Dr....
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 24 (AP) -- The German news agency, Transocean, colored its dispatches from New York to South America to indicate "Yankee intervention" in Latin America's domestic affairs, according to testimony given in District Court today by Dr. Hugo Fernandez Artucio of Montevideo, who exposed subversive activities in Uruguay.
docs.abstract: Dr H F Artucio testifies on German Transocean News Agency propaganda activities

docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, July 15 -- It is said here that when Dr. Getulio Vargas was Governor of his native State of Rio Grande do Sul and planned his revolution in 1930, two of his four secretaries were let into the secret while the two others were not.

docs.snippet: The intensive efforts of the United States to cement closer relations with South America are being increasingly reflected in foreign trade statistics. United States imports from South America during the first four months of 1941 totaled...
docs.lead_paragraph: The intensive efforts of the United States to cement closer relations with South America are being increasingly reflected in foreign trade statistics. United States imports from South America during the first four months of 1941 totaled $213,5,05,000, compared with $130,856,000 during the corresponding months of 1940, a gain of 63.2 per cent.
docs.abstract: U S-Latin Amer trade statistics, Jan-Apr; tables; chart; U S imports gain

docs.snippet: THE series which brings philately's first portrait of Thailand's youthful monarch, Ananda Mahidol, has reached New York. His likeness is on 2-satangs brown, 3s deep green, 5s violet and 10s dark red. A scene titled "Harvesting Thai Rice" is on 15s...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE series which brings philately's first portrait of Thailand's youthful monarch, Ananda Mahidol, has reached New York. His likeness is on 2-satangs brown, 3s deep green, 5s violet and 10s dark red. A scene titled "Harvesting Thai Rice" is on 15s deep blue and gray-black, 25s slate and orange and 50s red-orange and gray.

docs.lead_paragraph: LIMA, Peru, July 24 -- Americans will not tolerate interference by "the barbarians" of other continents in their affairs, the Rev. Dr. Joseph F. Thorning, director of The Sign Catholic seminar to South America, declared at a Summer session convocation at the University of San Marcos here.
